title: How to Convert Kilojoules to Calories

steps.title: Start with the number of kilojoules (kJ).
steps.content: Start with the number of kilojoules (kJ). Nutritional energy is often measured in kilojoules, but you can convert kJ to calories (cal) in a few simple steps. [1] X Research source For instance, let’s say you want to convert 5 kJ.

steps.title: Multiply the kilocalories (kJ) by 1,000 to get the number of joules (J).
steps.content: Multiply the kilocalories (kJ) by 1,000 to get the number of joules (J). Note that 1 kilojoule is equal to 1,000 joules. So, to convert from kilojoules to joules, multiply the number by 1,000. [2] X Research source For example, multiply 5 kJ by 1,000 to equal 5,000 J.

steps.title: Multiply the number of joules (J) by 0.239 to get the number of calories (cal).
steps.content: Multiply the number of joules (J) by 0.239 to get the number of calories (cal). Note that 1 kJ = 0.239 calories. So, to convert from joules to calories, all you have to do is multiply by 0.239. [3] X Research source For example, multiply 5,000 J by 0.239 to get 1,195 cal. Therefore, 5 kJ = 1,195 calories.

steps.title: Convert the calories (cal) into kilocalories (kcal) if desired.
steps.content: Convert the calories (cal) into kilocalories (kcal) if desired. Simply divide the number of calories by 1,000 to get the number of kilocalories. [4] X Research source For example, divide 1,195 cal by 1,000 to get 1.195 kilocalories. Therefore, 5kJ = 1.195 kcal.

steps.title: Divide the number of calories (cal) by 1,000 to find the number of kilocalories (kcal).
steps.content: Divide the number of calories (cal) by 1,000 to find the number of kilocalories (kcal). If you haven’t already, convert the number of calories to kilocalories. [5] X Trustworthy Source Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations Specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for leading international efforts to end world hunger and improve nutrition Go to source For instance, if you have 25 calories, divide this number by 1,000 to get 0.025 kcal.

steps.title: Multiply the kilocalories (kcal) by 4.185 to find the number of kilojoules (kJ).
steps.content: Multiply the kilocalories (kcal) by 4.185 to find the number of kilojoules (kJ). Note that 1 kcal = 4.184 kJ. So, to convert from kilocalories to kilojoules, multiply by 4.185. [6] X Trustworthy Source Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations Specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for leading international efforts to end world hunger and improve nutrition Go to source For example, multiply 0.025 kcal by 4.184 to get 0.105 kJ. So, 25 calories is equal to 0.105 kilojoules.

steps.title: Convert the kilojoules (kJ) to joules (J) if desired.
steps.content: Convert the kilojoules (kJ) to joules (J) if desired. If you need to know the number of joules, rather than kilojoules, simply multiply by 1,000. [7] X Trustworthy Source Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations Specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for leading international efforts to end world hunger and improve nutrition Go to source For example, multiply 0.105 kJ by 1,000 to get 105 joules. Therefore, 25 cal = 105 J.
